name: TheAtlantic
text: "Conventions have long been 'hot'—loud, unsubtle, the political version of infomercials. The Democrats were forced by the pandemic to be cool, and every political gathering from now on will have to reckon with how effective they were" writes @JamesFallows: https://t.co/cmNjAEyvZy

name: TheAtlantic
text: Corporate architecture has taken over, making every city look the same. A more appealing and habitable future would engage with the styles of local people and places, writes @Oniropolis. https://t.co/15ndmnYStS

name: TheAtlantic
text: "With the planet burning, the virus killing, the economy collapsing, and millions of Americans preparing to vote, the country’s leading political cabal has moved into a queasy post-policy space," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/N2NiKQG4cR
